page.title: 14 Farming
page.content: Most of the arable farmland in the area is a mixture of sandy soil and black fenland soil. The crops grown are mainly barley,wheat,sugar beet,oil seed rape,carrots and potatoes. One farm also grows asparagus which provides a lot of casual work for the residents during the season. The sugar beet is sent to the local sugar beet factory at Bury St.Edmunds and oil seed rape is a fairly new crop which has become more important in recent years due to the change in diet habits of the population who tend to now use vegetable oil more than animal fats for cooking. Livestock in the area is mainly intensively managed inside buildings. There is a pig farm,a chicken farm and another chicken farm that produces eggs and boiling fowls. There are many privately owned horses and ponies and a few cattle.
